item.title: Grab Holdings 季度收入超出预期
item.description: Grab Holdings周一公布的第三季度营收超出分析师预期，主要得益于其平台扩张吸引了更多用户，消费者在打车和送餐服务上的支出强劲。【原文：Grab Holdings beat analysts' expectations for third-quarter revenue on Monday, helped by robust consumer spending on ride-hailing and food-delivery services as its platform expansion draws in more users.】

item.title: 重塑星巴克布莱恩-尼科尔执掌星巴克第一年的重大举措
item.description: 布莱恩-尼科尔（Brian Niccol）于 2024 年 8 月接任星巴克首席执行官一职，当时这家咖啡连锁店正努力应对美国市场对其价格昂贵的拿铁咖啡需求疲软的问题，并考虑出售其中国分部的股份。【原文：Brian Niccol took over as Starbucks' CEO in August 2024, as the coffee chain struggled with weak demand for its pricey lattes in the U.S. and contemplated selling a stake in its China division.】

item.title: 欧盟贸易负责人认为耐克斯佩里亚谈判取得进展
item.description: 欧洲贸易委员马罗斯-塞夫科维奇（Maros Sefcovic）周一表示，涉及荷兰和中国的荷兰芯片制造商Nexperia的谈判正在取得进展。【原文：European Trade Commissioner Maros Sefcovic said on Monday that talks over the Dutch chipmaker Nexperia, which involve the Netherlands and China, were advancing.】

item.title: Kenvue的法律风险笼罩着金佰利公司的收购计划
item.description: 金佰利公司（Kimberly-Clark）周一表示，它计划收购创可贴生产商肯维公司（Kenvue），而后者正面临着涉及其止痛药泰诺（Tylenol）和含滑石粉的婴儿爽身粉的数千起诉讼。【原文：Kimberly-Clark said on Monday it plans to acquire Band-Aid maker Kenvue , even as the latter company faces thousands of lawsuits involving its painkiller Tylenol and talc-based baby powder, raising questions about the scope of the liabilities Kimberly-Clark might inherit.】

item.title: 交易日：经济现实打击了人工智能和交易的乐观情绪
item.description: 华尔街周一涨跌不一，企业交易活动活跃，另一项与人工智能相关的大型合作被美国经济增长和利率前景不明所抵消，而美元则升至三个月来的新高。【原文：Wall Street was mixed on Monday, with bumper corporate dealmaking activity and another mega AI-related tie-up offset by murky signals around the path for U.S. growth and interest rates, while the dollar crept up to a fresh three-month high.】

item.title: 星巴克将以 40 亿美元向博裕资本出售中国业务控制权
item.description: 星巴克周一表示，已同意将其中国业务的控制权出售给投资公司博裕资本，交易价值为 40 亿美元。【原文：Starbucks said on Monday it has agreed to sell control of its China operations to investment firm Boyu Capital in a deal valued at $4 billion.】

item.title: 宾夕法尼亚大学称已就数据泄露事件致电联邦调查局
item.description: 宾夕法尼亚大学称，在向校友分发了攻击性电子邮件后，该校已请联邦调查局介入调查。【原文：The University of Pennsylvania says it has called in the Federal Bureau of Investigation after offensive emails were distributed to alumni.】

item.title: 西蒙地产集团上调年度房地产 FFO 预期，原因是租赁需求恢复性增长
item.description: 商业地产投资信托公司西蒙地产集团（Simon Property Group）周一上调了全年房地产运营资金的预期，原因是其购物中心的租赁需求保持强劲。【原文：Commercial real estate investment trust Simon Property Group raised full-year forecast for real estate funds from operations on Monday, driven by resilient leasing demand across its shopping centers.】

item.title: 金佰利斥资 500 亿美元进军保健和美容业考验投资者信心
item.description: 金佰利公司（Kimberly-Clark）以近 500 亿美元的价格收购泰诺（Tylenol）生产商肯维公司（Kenvue），据分析师称，这是对全球最大的消费市场--美国--将持续增长的风险押注，即使低收入购物者削减预算。【原文：Kimberly-Clark's nearly $50 billion offer for Tylenol maker Kenvue is a risky bet that the world's biggest consumer market, the United States, will keep growing even as lower-income shoppers trim their budgets, according to analysts.】

item.title: 在被投资者主导的集团收购之前，Air Lease Corp 第三季度利润增长
item.description: 飞机租赁商航空租赁公司（Air Lease）周一公布第三季度利润增长，主要得益于飞机租赁收入的恢复性增长。【原文：Aircraft lessor Air Lease reported higher third-quarter profit on Monday, helped by resilient aircraft rental revenue.】

item.title: Hims and Hers 用户增长强劲，收入超出预期
item.description: 本周一，Hims and Hers Health 第三季度收入超出华尔街预期，原因是这家远程医疗公司增加了用户，并扩大了其个性化医疗服务。【原文：Hims and Hers Health beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter revenue on Monday, as the telehealth company added subscribers and expanded its personalized healthcare offerings.】

item.title: 人工智能概述抑制搜索流量，IAC 季度收入不及预期
item.description: 本周一，IAC 的季度营收不及华尔街预期，原因是在人工智能摘要兴起的背景下，访问其广告支持的搜索和内容网站的访客减少。【原文：IAC missed Wall Street expectations for quarterly revenue on Monday, as fewer visitors reached its ad-supported search and content websites amid the rise of AI-generated summaries.】

item.title: 科特拉能源公司季度利润不佳，上调 2025 年产量预期
item.description: 石油和天然气公司科特拉能源公司（Coterra Energy）周一公布的第三季度利润未能达到华尔街预期，原因是油价下跌抵消了产量的增长，但该公司上调了全年产量预期。【原文：Oil and gas firm Coterra Energy missed Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit on Monday, as lower oil prices offset a jump in production, but raised its annual production forecast.】

item.title: 人工智能需求稳健，Palantir 预计第四季度营收高于预期
item.description: Palantir Technologies 公司周一预测第四季度营收将高于分析师预期，原因是人工智能的快速应用促进了企业和政府对其数据分析服务的需求。【原文：Palantir Technologies forecast fourth-quarter revenue above analysts' estimates on Monday, as the rapid adoption of artificial intelligence boosts demand for its data analytics services from businesses and governments.】

item.title: 监督机构报告称，特朗普打压后，美国 CFPB 数据安全 "效果不佳
item.description: 周一发布的一份审计报告显示，唐纳德-特朗普总统今年早些时候对美国消费者金融保护局的打压，通过取消合同加剧了该机构的 IT 安全漏洞。【原文：President Donald Trump's clampdown on the U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau earlier this year has compounded IT security lapses at the agency through the cancellation of contracts, according to an audit report released on Monday.】

item.title: 美国与 Vulcan Elements 签订协议，促进稀土磁铁供应
item.description: Vulcan Elements 公司与美国政府和 ReElement Technologies 公司建立了合作伙伴关系，以扩大国内稀土磁铁的生产，这是该公司为确保关键矿物的供应和减少对中国的依赖而做出的最新努力。【原文：Vulcan Elements has struck a partnership with the U.S. government and ReElement Technologies to expand domestic rare earth magnet production, the latest effort to secure supplies of critical minerals and cut reliance on China.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，贝塔技术公司的首次公开募股定价为每股 34 美元
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一援引知情人士的话报道，电动飞机制造商贝塔科技公司（Beta Technologies）预计将把首次公开募股的价格定在每股 34 美元，高于其市场定价范围。【原文：Electric aircraft maker Beta Technologies is expected to price its initial public offering at $34 per share, which is above its marketed range, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 埃克森石油公司探索更多炼油厂升级，以生产高价值产品
item.description: 埃克森美孚的一位高管最近在接受路透社采访时表示，在今年启动了四个新的炼油和化工项目后，埃克森美孚正在寻找更多的机会来改造其他生产基地。【原文：After starting up operations at four new refining and chemicals initiatives this year, Exxon Mobil is surveying more opportunities to revamp other sites, an executive told Reuters in a recent interview.】

item.title: 航空集团称，超过 320 万美国航空乘客受到政府关门影响
item.description: 一家航空公司集团周一表示，自10月1日政府开始停摆以来，已有超过320万美国航空乘客因空中交通管制员的人员配置问题而受到延误或取消航班的影响。【原文：More than 3.2 million U.S. airline passengers have been impacted by delays or cancellations stemming from air traffic controller staffing issues since a government shutdown began on October 1, an airline group said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国最高法院可能驳回特朗普的哪些关税？
item.description: 美国最高法院将于周三就唐纳德-特朗普总统根据《国际紧急经济权力法》（IEEPA）征收关税的合法性进行口头辩论。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court holds oral arguments on Wednesday over the legality of President Donald Trump's tariffs imposed under a law called the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, or IEEPA, that never previously was used for such a purpose.】

item.title: 特斯拉遭家属起诉，称故障车门导致起火车祸造成过失致人死亡
item.description: 特斯拉因威斯康星州的一起火烧车事故而被起诉，该事故造成一辆 Model S 车内的五名乘客全部死亡，据称由于设计缺陷，他们被困在车内，无法打开车门。【原文：Tesla has been sued over a fiery Wisconsin crash that killed all five occupants of a Model S, who were allegedly trapped inside because of a design flaw that prevented them from opening the sedan's doors.】

item.title: 美联储主席库克承认试图罢免她，但拒绝在法律诉讼中发表评论
item.description: 美联储理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）周一表示，在特朗普政府试图解雇她之际，能在央行工作 "是我一生的荣幸"。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook on Monday said "it is the honor of my life" to work at the central bank amid attempts by the Trump administration to fire her.】

item.title: 美联储库克：12月将迎来降息，但将取决于传入的信息
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会（Federal Reserve）理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）周一表示，她认为 12 月份的美联储会议是潜在降息的 "直播 "会议，但她将根据从现在到那时的各种来源的信息做出决定，可能会在没有因联邦关门而推迟的政府数据的情况下做出决定。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook said on Monday she considers December's Fed meeting "live" for a potential rate cut but that she will make her decision based on information from a broad variety of sources between now and then, potentially in the absence of government data delayed by the federal shutdown.】

item.title: 消息人士称，俄罗斯推动欧佩克+暂停行动未遭沙特抵制
item.description: 欧佩克+组织的四位消息人士称，欧佩克及其盟国周日决定明年第一季度保持石油产量目标稳定，此前俄罗斯曾游说暂停石油产量，因为西方制裁将使其难以增加出口。【原文：The decision by OPEC and its allies on Sunday to keep oil output targets steady in the first quarter of next year came after Russia lobbied for the pause because it would struggle to increase exports due to Western sanctions, four OPEC+ sources said.】

item.title: 三星在 OLED 专利审判中被美国陪审团判决赔偿 1.914 亿美元
item.description: 德克萨斯州联邦法院的一个陪审团周一表示，三星电子因侵犯美国两项有机发光二极管技术专利而欠专利所有人 Pictiva Displays 1.914 亿美元的赔偿金。【原文：Samsung Electronics owes patent owner Pictiva Displays $191.4 million in damages for infringing two U.S. patents covering organic light-emitting diode technology, a jury in Texas federal court said on Monday.】

item.title: 美联储主席戴利表示支持最近一次降息，并对 12 月再次降息持开放态度
item.description: 旧金山联储主席玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）周一表示，她支持美国央行上周的降息行动，并希望通过筛选新收到的数据来评估是否有必要在 12 月 9-10 日的会议上再次降低借贷成本。【原文：San Francisco Federal Reserve President Mary Daly on Monday said she supported the U.S. central bank's interest rate cut last week, and will want to sift through incoming data to assess if another reduction in borrowing costs is warranted at the December 9-10 meeting.】

item.title: TechMet 将增加投资组合，担心欧洲在关键矿产争夺战中败北
item.description: 美国支持的投资机构TechMet的首席执行官正在评估投资组合的补充情况，包括竞购乌克兰的一个锂矿床，但他担心欧洲在建设关键矿产部门以削弱中国的主导地位方面落后于美国。【原文：The CEO of U.S.-backed investment vehicle TechMet is evaluating portfolio additions, including bidding for a Ukraine lithium deposit, but worries that Europe is lagging behind the U.S. in building a critical minerals sector to reduce Chinese dominance.】

item.title: 希波克拉底人工智能公司在最新一轮融资中估值 35 亿美元
item.description: 希波克拉底人工智能公司（Hippocratic AI）周一表示，该公司在 Avenir Growth 领投的最新一轮融资中筹集了 1.26 亿美元，使这家医疗保健公司的估值达到 35 亿美元，凸显了风险资本对人工智能集成公司的浓厚兴趣。【原文：Hippocratic AI raised $126 million in its latest funding round led by Avenir Growth, it said on Monday, valuing the healthcare company at $3.5 billion and underscoring venture capital's strong interest towards artificial intelligence-integrated companies.】

item.title: 标普 500 指数和纳斯达克指数在亚马逊与 OpenAI 达成交易后上涨；Kenvue 在被收购后跳涨
item.description: 周一，美国 500 指数和纳斯达克指数走高，此前一系列人工智能交易提振了超大型公司亚马逊和英伟达，而美联储官员的鹰派言论则抑制了市场的乐观情绪。【原文：The S&P 500 and Nasdaq edged higher on Monday, after a slew of AI deals boosted megacap companies Amazon and Nvidia, while hawkish comments from Federal Reserve officials kept optimism in check.】

item.title: 迪士尼要求 YouTube TV 恢复美国广播公司的大选日报道
item.description: 迪斯尼公司要求谷歌的 YouTube TV 恢复美国广播公司在大选日的报道，以维护公众利益。【原文：Disney has asked Google's YouTube TV to restore ABC for Election Day coverage in service of public interest, just days after its networks went dark on the pay-TV platform.】
